regress.comment: In reality, the epics pv AMO:R14:IOC:10:ao0:out1 points to pvId 134. However that pvName has been reused as a epics alias. The alias points to pvid 44 and that is what psana is doing, letting the epics alias override the pvname. Unfortunately, there is no way to get at the unaliased pvname because of this, so the Translator does not set up these aliases - thus the difference.

Before I turned off printing the pvid, I had differences. Now that I do not dump the pvid's I do not get differences, but here are the notes from before:
The first difference shows 5 pv's that showed up in the event data for the xtc that are not in the event data for the h5. The first one, CXI:KB1:MMS:07.RBV, is from a second epics source (xtclinedump):
xtc d=2 offset=0x000472D8 extent=000000B4 dmg=00000 src=010020EB,09000001 level=1 srcnm=EpicsArch.0:NoDevice.1 typeid=13 ver=1 value=1000D compr=0 compr_ver=1 type_name=Epics plen=160 dbr=34 numElem=1 pvId=0 pvName=CXI:KB1:MMS:07.RBV payload=0x00...
however note that it is also in the typical epics source (xtclinedump):
xtc d=2 offset=0x00069F40 extent=000000B4 dmg=00000 src=010064CE,09000000 level=1 srcnm=EpicsArch.0:NoDevice.0 typeid=13 ver=1 value=1000D compr=0 compr_ver=1 type_name=Epics plen=160 dbr=34 numElem=1 pvId=219 pvName=CXI:KB1:MMS:07.RBV payload=0xDB...
During the configure or beginJob, the dump shows the same thing for this pv (psana_test.dump):
pvName=CXI:KB1:MMS:07.RBV pvid=219 dbrtype=34 isCtrl=1 numElements=1 status=0 severity=0 units=mrad upper_disp_limit=2.0000e+02 lower_disp_limit=-2.0000e+02 upper_alarm_limit=0.0000e+00 upper_warning_limit=0.0000e+00 lower_warning_limit=0.0000e+00 lower_alarm_limit=0.0000e+00 upper_ctrl_limit=2.0000e+02 lower_ctrl_limit=-2.0000e+02 data=8.9570e-03
When we get to the first event, both the xtc and h5 dump's have the pv:
pvName=CXI:KB1:MMS:07.RBV pvid=219 dbrtype=20 isTime=1 numElements=1 status=0 severity=0 stamp.sec=736527078 stamp.nsec=98899000 data=9.0100e-03
But then when we get to the second event, there is another entry for it in the xtc:
=== event: run=0 step=0 event=1 seconds= 1367679098 nanoseconds= 61318067 fiducials= 579 Epics PV pvName=CXI:KB1:MMS:07.RBV pvid=0 dbrtype=20 isTime=1 numElements=1 status=0 severity=0 stamp.sec=736527078 stamp.nsec=98899000 data=9.0100e-03
however note that this timestamp is the same as the first event timestamp. The issue is that the Translator does not bring in new epics unless the timestamp changes. psana_test.dump is re-printing the epics if anything in the pv string changes. Here the change is that the second source is transmiting the pv on event 2, and the pvId has changed. So the pvId can change from one event to the next with psana.

There was a bug here trac #304. See notes at https://pswww.slac.stanford.edu/trac/psdm/ticket/304 that is now fixed. See also trac # 305 that is fixed now.
Here are additional notes that make this file interesting:
In the xtclinedump, this pv shows up during configure:
dg= 1 offset=0x00000000 tp=Event sv= Configure ex=1 ev=0 sec=51E9F8AF nano=0E1A3D7E tcks=0000000 fid=1FFFF ctrl=84 vec=0000 env=000024F4 xtc d=2 offset=0x0000048C extent=000000B4 dmg=00000 src=010044F7,09000001 level=1 srcnm=EpicsArch.0:NoDevice.1 typeid=13 ver=1 value=1000D compr=0 compr_ver=1 type_name=Epics plen=160 payload=0x04... epics: pvId=4 dbrType=34 numElem=1 isCtrl=1 isTime=0 pvName=CXI:SC2:MZM:09:ENCPOSITIONGET status=0 severity=0 units= upper_disp_limit=0.0000e+00 lower_disp_limit=0.0000e+00 upper_alarm_limit=nan upper_warning_limit=nan lower_warning_l
it is pvid=4 from src 1, there is an alias to it:
xtc d=2 offset=0x0000003C extent=00000180 dmg=00000 src=010044F7,09000001 level=1 srcnm=EpicsArch.0:NoDevice.1 typeid=54 ver=1 value=10036 compr=0 compr_ver=1 type_name=EpicsConfig plen=364 payload=0x05... pvId= 4 descr=KB1 Vert Foucssing Mirror Pitch-CXI:SC2:MZM:09:ENCPOSITIONGET
it also named in the arch 0 aliases:
xtc d=2 offset=0x00058710 extent=00004110 dmg=00000 src=010004E5,09000000 level=1 srcnm=EpicsArch.0:NoDevice.0 typeid=54 ver=1 value=10036 compr=0 compr_ver=1 type_name=EpicsConfig plen=16636 payload=0xE7... pvId= 46 descr=CXI:SC2:MZM:09:ENCPOSITIONGET
This is very confusing, as that alias name of 09 points to 10: xtc d=2 offset=0x0005ECDC extent=000000B4 dmg=00000 src=010004E5,09000000 level=1 srcnm=EpicsArch.0:NoDevice.0 typeid=13 ver=1 value=1000D compr=0 compr_ver=1 type_name=Epics plen=160 payload=0x2E... epics: pvId=46 dbrType=34 numElem=1 isCtrl=1 isTime=0 pvName=CXI:SC2:MZM:10:ENCPOSITIONGET status=0 severity=0 units= upper_disp_limit=0.0000e+00 lower_disp_limit=0.0000e+00 upper_alarm_limit=nan upper_warning_limit=nan lower_warning_
When I look in the dump, in the h5 dump: pvName=CXI:SC2:MZM:08:ENCPOSITIONGET dbrtype=34 isCtrl=1 numElements=1 status=0 severity=0 units= upper_disp_limit=0.0000e+00 lower_disp_limit=0.0000e+00 upper_alarm_limit=nan upper_warning_limit=nan lower_warning_limit=nan lower_alarm_limit=nan upper_ctrl_limit=0.0000e+00 lower_ctrl_limit=0.0000e+00 data=5.4000e-01 pvName=CXI:SC2:MZM:10:ENCPOSITIONGET dbrtype=34 isCtrl=1 numElements=1 status=0 severity=0 units= upper_disp_limit=0.0000e+00 lower_disp_limit=0.0000e+00 upper_alarm_limit=nan upper_warning_limit=nan lower_warning_limit=nan lower_alarm_limit=nan upper_ctrl_limit=0.0000e+00 lower_ctrl_limit=0.0000e+00 data=-2.5000e-02
this guy, 09 is skipped!
for the xtc: pvName=CXI:SC2:MZM:08:ENCPOSITIONGET dbrtype=34 isCtrl=1 numElements=1 status=0 severity=0 units= upper_disp_limit=0.0000e+00 lower_disp_limit=0.0000e+00 upper_alarm_limit=nan upper_warning_limit=nan lower_warning_limit=nan lower_alarm_limit=nan upper_ctrl_limit=0.0000e+00 lower_ctrl_limit=0.0000e+00 data=5.4000e-01 pvName=CXI:SC2:MZM:09:ENCPOSITIONGET dbrtype=34 isCtrl=1 numElements=1 status=0 severity=0 units= upper_disp_limit=0.0000e+00 lower_disp_limit=0.0000e+00 upper_alarm_limit=nan upper_warning_limit=nan lower_warning_limit=nan lower_alarm_limit=nan upper_ctrl_limit=0.0000e+00 lower_ctrl_limit=0.0000e+00 data=-2.5000e-02 pvName=CXI:SC2:MZM:10:ENCPOSITIONGET dbrtype=34 isCtrl=1 numElements=1 status=0 severity=0 units= upper_disp_limit=0.0000e+00 lower_disp_limit=0.0000e+00 upper_alarm_limit=nan upper_warning_limit=nan lower_warning_limit=nan lower_alarm_limit=nan upper_ctrl_limit=0.0000e+00 lower_ctrl_limit=0.0000e+00 data=-2.5000e-02
there he is!
When I run the translator:
psanacs049:~/rel/transReFact $ psana -n 6 -m Translator.H5Output -o Translator.H5Output.output_file=psana_test/data/current_h5/test_010_cxi_cxia4113_e325-r0002-s00-c00.regress.h5 -o Translator.H5Output.overwrite=True /reg/g/psdmcxi_cxia4113_e325-r0002-s00-c00.xtc [warning:2014-06-02 16:14:45.418:ExpNameFromDs.cpp:65] ExpNameFromDs: dataset name /reg/g/psdm/data_test/Translator/test_010_cxi_cxia4113_e325-r0002-s00-c00.xtc has no valid experiment number [info:Translator.H5Output] output file: psana_test/data/current_h5/test_010_cxi_cxia4113_e325-r0002-s00-c00.regress.h5 [info:Translator.H5Output] param overwrite = 1 (non-default value) [info:Translator.H5Output] Starting translation process 2014-06-02 16:14:45.843709000-0700 [warning:2014-06-02 16:14:45.880:EpicsH5GroupDirectory.cpp:143] normalized alias 'CXI:SC2:MZM:09:ENCPOSITIONGET' (which points to 'CXI:SC2:MZM:10:ENCPOSITIONGET') is the same as existing group. skipping. [info:Translator.H5Output] : endJob 2014-06-02 16:14:46.526842000-0700 [info:Translator.H5Output] real time (finish - start): 0.683133 (sec) = 0.0113855 (min)
I see that I am skipping the alias, but why did the group get skipped?
This looks like the same thing as test 8

regress.comment: This is not a big deal, to have zero dimensional arrays show up as 0x384 in the xtc but 0x0 in the hdf5 translation.
This looks like the same thing as test 8
